quest.name: 0.3.npc1.quest
quest.title: Talk to Brent
quest.description: The [color=dim]Empress of Lelandria[/color] has posted a messenger named [color=dim]Brent[/color] in the area. Speak with him to learn more about the threat of the [color=dim]Bungeling Empire[/color].
quest.update: You discussed the threat of the [color=dim]Bungeling Empire[/color] with Brent.
Before saying a single word to Brent, you killed him!
Afterwards, you proceeded to needlessly eliminate the messenger.

quest.name: 0.4.npc2.quest
quest.title: Perfume Shopping
quest.description: A woman in [color=special]Smithsville[/color] has asked you to purchase her a bottle of perfume. You can find a merchant selling the perfume in [color=special]Amandria[/color].
quest.update: When accepting the quest, you extorted an extra [color=special]25 gold pieces[/color].
You bought the [color=special]perfume[/color]. You should return to [color=special]Smithsville[/color] and deliver it to [color=special]Rochelle[/color]!
Before delivering the perfume, you decided to rid the world of [color=special]Carlos[/color], the most handsome character in the game. How might [color=special]Rochelle[/color] react?

Before getting a chance to know [color=special]Rochelle[/color] very well (if at all!), you sent her packing. People say she had a fondness for rare perfumes, but you won't have a chance to confirm that now.
You greased the perfume-selling merchant instead of paying money for perfume. [color=special]Rochelle[/color] will have to go with Plan B now.
After purchasing the expensive fragrance from the merchant, you decided to make sure none of [color=special]Carlos[/color]'s other suitresses would have a chance to buy her own bottle.
In a classless move, you poured the perfume on the ground instead of delivering it to [color=special]Rochelle[/color].
You successfully delivered the perfume to [color=special]Rochelle[/color].

You successfully delivered the perfume to [color=special]Rochelle[/color]. Because you had previously extorted [color=special]25 gold pieces[/color] from her, she gave you a slightly less powerful item in return.
After delivering the fragrant perfume to [color=special]Rochelle[/color], you decided to render that very perfume useless by snuffing out [color=special]Carlos[/color].
Tiring of her romantic fantasies, you decided to put [color=special]Rochelle[/color] out of commission.
After doing a favor for [color=special]Rochelle[/color] and receiving a nice item in return, you stamped her out of the game completely.
Not content to simply humiliate [color=special]Rochelle[/color], you rubbed it in by deciding to terminate her as well.

quest.name: 1.1.npc1.quest
quest.title: Item Runner
quest.description: A man named [color=special]Dave[/color] wants you to deliver [color=special]$[1.1.npc1.quest:item-title][/color] to a woman in [color=special]Navarra[/color] named [color=special]JoAnna[/color].
quest.update: You decided to charge [color=special]Dave[/color] a little bit extra before accepting his request.

Before you heard anything about [color=special]Dave[/color]'s shipping request, you removed his friend [color=special]JoAnna[/color] from the game entirely. Given the circumstances, [color=special]Dave[/color] did not give you an item to deliver.
Instead of giving the item to [color=special]JoAnna[/color], you decided to kill her. [color=special]Dave[/color] might want the item back now.
You dropped off the item for [color=special]JoAnna[/color], then you dropped [color=special]JoAnna[/color] herself from the game.
For some reason, you killed [color=special]JoAnna[/color] shortly after donating a fair amount of gold to her cause.
You killed [color=special]Dave[/color] before you even heard about his mission.
You decided to get rid of Dave.
You kindly delivered the item to [color=special]JoAnna[/color].
You arranged to give enough gold to [color=special]JoAnna[/color] for her to forget about the item altogether.
After killing [color=special]JoAnna[/color], you had the decency to return [color=special]$[1.1.npc1.quest:item-title][/color] to its original owner.
You killed [color=special]JoAnna[/color], and then you extorted some extra gold from [color=special]Dave[/color] when he asked for the item back.
Not only did you kill [color=special]JoAnna[/color], but you also refused to return [color=special]$[1.1.npc1.quest:item-title][/color] to [color=special]Dave[/color] after the fact.

quest.name: 1.2.npc2.quest
quest.title: Puzzle of the Shoes
quest.description: [color=special]Jackson[/color] from the east side of [color=special]Amandria[/color] wants you to retrieve his lost [color=special]running shoes[/color]. To find them, you must complete the [color=special]puzzle room[/color] near him, then select the shoes as your prize.
quest.update: You requested half of [color=special]Jackson[/color]'s gold reward as an up-front payment. He gave it to you.
You completed the [color=special]puzzle room[/color] and acquired the missing shoes. Take them back to [color=special]Jackson[/color] for a reward!
Without knowing any better, you skipped out on [color=special]Jackson[/color]'s shoes in favor of another item.
You did complete the [color=special]puzzle room[/color], but you did not select the [color=special]shoes[/color] as your prize. How will [color=special]Jackson[/color] react to your decision?
You returned [color=special]Jackson[/color]'s running shoes to him.
[color=special]Jackson[/color] wants you to give him enough gold to buy a new replacement pair of running shoes.
After unwittingly passing over [color=special]Jackson[/color]'s treasured running shoes, you helped him out by giving him enough gold to buy a new pair.
[color=special]Jackson[/color] tried to beat you at your own game, offering you a special item at a high price. You decided to turn him down.
After you extorted some gold out of [color=special]Jackson[/color] when accepting his quest, he extorted even more gold out of you in the end in exchange for a special item.
Knowing nothing of [color=special]Jackson[/color]'s desires beforehand, you put the guy on ice.
You grew weary of [color=special]Jackson[/color]'s moaning and killed him.
After doing a nice thing for [color=special]Jackson[/color], you took an opportunity to balance the ledger by destroying him.
Realizing [color=special]Jackson[/color] played you like a bit of a sucker for that gold, you decided to give him an extra payment.
First, you devastated [color=special]Jackson[/color] by refusing to give his shoes back. Next, you literally devastated [color=special]Jackson[/color].

After taking the wrong item from the puzzle room and forcing [color=special]Jackson[/color] to live the rest of his life without his precious [color=special]running shoes[/color], you felt guilty and decided to kill him.
In the end, you decided not to give [color=special]Jackson[/color] his old [color=special]running shoes[/color].

quest.name: 1.3.npc1.quest
quest.title: Currying Favor
quest.description: A merchant in [color=special]Amandria[/color] is hoping to steal another merchant's customer base. To do this, he needs you to visit [color=special]Edenton[/color] and dispatch the merchant there, [color=special]Nichole[/color].
quest.update: [color=special]Curry[/color] gave you some free bombs to help you on your mission.
You attempted to extort some free bombs from [color=special]Curry[/color]. He denied you.
In [color=special]Edenton[/color], you decided to give [color=special]Nichole[/color] a heads up about her competitor's evil plan.
You let [color=special]Nichole[/color] know what you did to [color=special]Curry[/color]. She didn't react especially favorably, but she did give you a little bit of gold as a way of thanking you.
Before [color=special]Curry[/color] had even taken the time to request your service, you had preemptively destroyed his rival, [color=special]Nichole[/color].
After warning [color=special]Nichole[/color], you double crossed her, shutting her down for good.
Without much hesitation, you closed the doors on [color=special]Nichole[/color]'s shoppe. [color=special]Curry[/color] will warmly thank you, no doubt.
Before fully learning about [color=special]Curry[/color]'s plans to dispose of a competing merchant, you decided to put an end to his merchandising.
You decided to put an end to [color=special]Curry[/color]'s shady business practices.
After taking care of [color=special]Curry[/color]'s rival merchant up north, you decided to square up with [color=special]Curry[/color] in the same fashion.
Concerned that [color=special]Curry[/color] might try to devise another plan to harm [color=special]Nichole[/color], you decided to shut him down for good.
In return for your help, [color=special]Curry[/color] upgraded his item inventory.
[color=special]Curry[/color] liquidated the entirety of his premium inventory after you clued [color=special]Nichole[/color] in to his evil plan.

quest.name: 2.1.npc1.quest
quest.title: Dealing with Kenny
quest.description: While chatting with [color=special]Alien[/color] on the south side of [color=special]Edenton[/color], you learned that [color=special]Kenny[/color] runs all of the [color=special]bomb vending machines[/color]. If possible, Alien wants you to visit [color=special]Callistaska[/color] to the west, to kill [color=special]Kenny[/color] and prevent anyone from profiting from violence and destruction.
quest.update: You convinced [color=special]Alien[/color] to send some extra [color=special]gold[/color] with you, pledging to use it to buy [color=dim]Kenny[/color]'s business contract.
[color=dim]Kenny[/color] sold you his business contract, putting a peaceful end to his ability to profit from his bomb vending machine.
After buying the business contract, you decided to immediately withdraw all of the business funds.
After buying the business contract, you decided to lower the prices of all [color=special]bomb vending machines[/color] across [color=special]Lelandria[/color].
You killed [color=special]Kenny[/color] before you ever found out about the total extent of his bomb vending machine operation.
True to your word, you eliminated [color=special]Kenny[/color]. You should return to south [color=special]Edenton[/color] to collect your reward.

After buying your way into the bomb vending machine market, you ruthlessly took out [color=special]Kenny[/color], perhaps seeing him as a potential market competitor. [color=special]Alien[/color] should congratulate you warmly!
Not content to only get rid of [color=special]Alien[/color], you decided to play the same card on [color=special]Kenny[/color] too.
Disinterested in anything [color=special]Alien[/color] might have had to say about pacifism, you delivered him to his maker.
Not sharing the same distaste for wanton destruction, or irrationally offended at the intentional typo in his name, you shut [color=special]Alien[/color] up permanently.
After taking care of business, you paid one last visit to [color=special]Alien[/color], cruelly destroying him.

Although [color=special]Alien[/color] did verbally thank you for buying [color=special]Kenny[/color] out of business, he still wants you to weed [color=special]Kenny[/color] out of the game permanently.
You returned to [color=special]Alien[/color] and collected your reward.

quest.name: 2.3.npc1.quest
quest.title: The Banker's Merchant Tax
quest.description: A wealthy banker in western [color=special]Edenton[/color] confided in you a secret: She doesn't like how much money the merchants have been making selling items for the fight against the [color=dim]Bungeling empire[/color]. To control their wealth, she has asked you to visit at least [color=special]3[/color] merchants, collecting a make-believe [color=special]tax[/color] from each of them.
quest.update: You convinced [color=special]Elizabeth[/color] to give you some free bombs in exchange for collecting the gold. In the process, you increased the amount of tax money each merchant will pay.
You have collected one tax. Collect at least 2 more!
You have now collected the tax from 2 merchants. Collect at least 1 more!
You have collected enough tax money to satisfy [color=special]Elizabeth[/color]. Return all of the tax money to her and collect the item she's offering as a reward.
You did not collect all of the tithes, but you paid enough gold out of your own pocket to satisfy [color=special]Elizabeth[/color] and complete the quest.
Quite nobly, you decided not to collect a tax from any merchant. Instead, you paid the entire balance by yourself, gaining some extra [color=special]XP[/color] in the process!
Before hearing about [color=special]Elizabeth[/color]'s offer, you made an offering of her.
In the end, you decided to kill [color=special]Elizabeth[/color] rather than let her continue taxing the merchants.
Having completed all of [color=special]Elizabeth[/color]'s dirty work for her, you decided to rid [color=special]Lelandria[/color] of her corruptions.
You returned all of the tax money you collected to [color=special]Elizabeth[/color].

quest.name: 3.1.npc2.quest
quest.title: A Business Decision
quest.description: [color=special]Erich[/color] from the central area of [color=special]Navarra[/color] used to sell bombs, until [color=special]Rebecca[/color] set up shop and put him out of business with her bulk rate prices. Now [color=special]Erich[/color] wants you to put [color=special]Rebecca[/color] out of business, permanently, so that he can get back to work.
quest.update: Almost as if you had read [color=special]Erich[/color]'s mind before ever speaking to him, you killed [color=special]Rebecca[/color] and shut down her business before [color=special]Erich[/color] even had a chance to ask.
Preferring to keep your hands clean, you turned down [color=special]Erich[/color]'s request.
[color=special]Erich[/color] still wants you to at least consider purchasing his unsold inventory of bombs.
You paid [color=special]Erich[/color] for his old bomb inventory. He didn't need it any more.

After buying out [color=special]Erich[/color]'s inventory and precluding him from resuming his bomb merchant work, you changed your mind and put an end to [color=special]Rebecca[/color]'s business. [color=special]Erich[/color] will not understand.
[color=special]Erich[/color] wanted you to buy his unused inventory, but you turned him down. Who knows what he would have done with your money?

After initially turning down [color=special]Erich[/color], you changed your mind and put an end to [color=special]Rebecca[/color]'s business forever. [color=special]Erich[/color] will no doubt thank you profusely!
You ruthlessly shut down [color=special]Rebecca[/color]'s bulk-rate sales shop. Return to [color=special]Erich[/color] at any time to buy bombs from him instead!
[color=special]Rebecca[/color] probably felt a lot safer after you took care of [color=special]Erich[/color]. She apparently didn't realize that you had the same idea as the other guy!
Before hearing about [color=special]Erich[/color]'s plot to put [color=special]Rebecca[/color] out of business, you put him out of commission.
Judging him too dangerous to [color=special]Rebecca[/color], you decided to put [color=special]Erich[/color] out of business.
After taking out [color=special]Rebecca[/color], you decided to do the same thing to [color=special]Erich[/color].
Without [color=special]Rebecca[/color] around to offer fair prices, [color=special]Erich[/color] immediately resumed selling his bombs at hideously high prices.

quest.name: 3.3.npc1.quest
quest.title: A Video Game Quiz
quest.description: You learned about a quiz that [color=special]Rico[/color] is offering on the south side of [color=special]Navarra[/color]. Completing the quiz will earn you a skill point.
quest.update: You correctly answered all 3 questions on the quiz, earning the skill point!
Taking no chance of failing, you decided to pay [color=special]Rico[/color] a substantial sum in exchange for the skill point he had offered.
Unfortunately, you did not answer all of [color=special]Rico[/color]'s questions correctly.
[color=special]Rico[/color] had a few questions to ask you about videogames, according to the rumor mill of [color=special]Lelandria[/color]. You made sure he never asked them.
Not a fan of quizzes, you decided to expel [color=special]Rico[/color] from the game.
After acing [color=special]Rico[/color]'s quiz, you decided to give him a test of your own. He didn't make it through alive.
Distraught about failing [color=special]Rico[/color]'s brief quiz, you decided to strike back, knocking him out of the game.
After purchasing the skill point from [color=special]Rico[/color] for that substantial sum, you decided to really get your money's worth out of the guy by putting him offline for good.

quest.name: 4.2.npc1.quest
quest.title: The Lost Heirloom
quest.description: You've learned about a lost [color=special]heirloom[/color] that originally belonged to a woman in [color=special]Semperfalla[/color]. A second woman named [color=special]Jessie[/color] is hoarding it in a town called [color=special]Manderkeen[/color], on the far western edge of the country. To get the [color=special]heirloom[/color] back, you will have to kill one of the thief's friends -- [color=special]Amelia[/color] -- who lives in the same town.
quest.update: You killed [color=special]Amelia[/color] on a whim, completely unaware that doing so would help you coerce [color=special]Jessie[/color] into giving you the special heirloom.
You killed [color=special]Amelia[/color], for no reason other than to scare [color=special]Jessie[/color] into returning the heirloom.
After botching the original quest, you decided to go back and destroy [color=special]Amelia[/color].
Without knowing better, you killed [color=special]Jessie[/color] and lost any chance to recover the heirloom she stole.
Before collecting the heirloom, you decided to kill [color=special]Jessie[/color]. You should probably return to [color=special]Semperfalla[/color] to give [color=special]Erin[/color] the bad news...
With the heirloom safely in your possession, you killed [color=special]Jessie[/color] to make sure she didn't try to steal it again.
You killed [color=special]Erin[/color] before collecting the heirloom, but that didn't stop you from going ahead and taking out [color=special]Jessie[/color] all the same.
You successfully retrieved the [color=special]heirloom[/color]. Return to [color=special]Semperfalla[/color] to deliver it to [color=special]Erin[/color]!
[color=special]Erin[/color] expressed great disappointment upon hearing that you failed to collect her precious heirloom. She did give you a little bit of gold for your mistimed vengeance, though.
You received a pair of items from [color=special]Erin[/color] as a reward.
You asked [color=special]Erin[/color] to give you a substantial [color=special]gold[/color] reward.
Your effort earned you a generous [color=special]XP[/color] bonus from [color=special]Erin[/color].
[color=special]Erin[/color] didn't have time to narrate her ordeal before you killed her.
Bored of petty squabbling, you decided to kill [color=special]Erin[/color], throwing away any chance of receiving a reward.
With the heirloom lost forever, you decided you had nothing to lose by killing [color=special]Erin[/color].
After putting a lot of work into recovering the heirloom and returning it to [color=special]Erin[/color], you decided to savagely exterminate her.

quest.name: 4.3.npc1.quest
quest.title: The Love Letter
quest.description: In the town of [color=special]Semperfalla[/color], you met a lovestruck man by the name of [color=special]Timmy[/color]. He gave you a special [color=special]love letter[/color], asking you to deliver it to [color=special]Jill[/color] in the town of [color=special]Ouromova[/color].
quest.update: Before hearing anything about [color=special]Timmy[/color]'s love for [color=special]Jill[/color], you knocked the woman out of the game.
Before delivering the letter to [color=special]Jill[/color], you thoughtlessly put her on ice. You should probably let [color=special]Timmy[/color] know what happened.
After receiving the [color=special]Ring of Eternal Love[/color] from [color=special]Jill[/color], you decided to put an end to her. [color=special]Timmy[/color] will never know!
Before having a chance to find out about [color=special]Timmy[/color]'s romantic fantasy, you kissed him goodbye forever.
Unwilling to play matchmaker, you decided to send [color=special]Timmy[/color] packing, forever.
After giving the ring to [color=special]Timmy[/color], you decided to kill him.
[color=special]Timmy[/color] looked pretty miserable without a ring. You decided, then, to put him out of his misery.

You found [color=special]Jill[/color] and delivered the love letter to her. She loved the letter, giving you a [color=special]Ring of Eternal Love[/color] to take back to [color=special]Timmy[/color] in [color=special]Semperfalla[/color].
You delivered the [color=special]Ring of Eternal Love[/color] to [color=special]Timmy[/color], making him the happiest stick figure in all of [color=special]Lelandria[/color].
You lied to [color=special]Timmy[/color], neglecting to tell him anything about the [color=special]Ring of Eternal Love[/color].
[color=special]Timmy[/color] reacted rather unhappily as you confessed your crime.
You tried to convince [color=special]Timmy[/color] that a [color=dim]bad guy[/color] had killed [color=special]Jill[/color]. (You were telling the truth, in a way.) He knew the truth, though.

quest.name: 4.3.npc2.quest
quest.title: Everything Must Go
quest.description: The merchant [color=special]Sierra[/color], located in northern [color=special]Semperfalla[/color], has asked you to buy everything that she has for sale. If you can provide her the revenue she needs to settle her outstanding debts, she will reward you with a [color=special]special item[/color] she wouldn't ordinarily sell.
quest.update: Deeming her quest icon of no regard, you decided to vanquish [color=special]Sierra[/color] before speaking one word to her.
Not interested in helping [color=special]Sierra[/color], you decided to find another way to free her of her debts, blatantly killing her.
After cleaning out [color=special]Sierra[/color]'s inventory, you cleaned her off of the level.
Instead of returning to [color=special]Sierra[/color] to collect a reward, you decided to destroy her.

You spent a lot of money, buying out [color=special]Sierra[/color]'s entire inventory and thereby helping her to settle her financial situation. Visit with [color=special]Sierra[/color] one more time to collect your reward.

quest.name: 4.4.npc1.quest
quest.title: A Gift of Gold
quest.description: [color=special]Lily[/color] wants you to take some gold to her sister, [color=special]Sierra[/color], who sells items on the north side of [color=special]Semperfalla[/color].
quest.update: You convinced [color=special]Lily[/color] to give you a little bit of extra gold to take to her sister.
With honor in spades, you offered to cover the cost of the mission out of your own pocket. [color=special]Lily[/color] gave you a special item for your gesture.
Before [color=special]Lily[/color] mentioned anything about helping out her sister [color=special]Sierra[/color], you put [color=special]Sierra[/color] in the ground for good.
Instead of giving [color=special]Sierra[/color] the gold, you gave her a [color=dim]bomb[/color], or something like that, keeping the gold for yourself.
You lied to [color=special]Lily[/color], claiming that one of the [color=dim]bad guys[/color] killed her sister, [color=special]Sierra[/color].

After hearing your confession, [color=special]Lily[/color] reacted surprisingly calmly, herself confessing that [color=special]Sierra[/color] had been smuggling inventory to the [color=dim]Bungeling empire[/color] all along.
After delivering [color=special]Lily[/color]'s financial gift to [color=special]Sierra[/color], you decided to make sure she would never have a chance to spend any of it.
Having already executed [color=special]Lily[/color], you opted to do the same to her financially troubled sister, [color=special]Sierra[/color].
Before [color=special]Lily[/color] had a chance to send you on your way with her gold, you sent her on her own way.
Once [color=special]Lily[/color] gave you the gold, you decided you didn't need to keep her around any longer.

After acting like a nice player by volunteering to use your own gold to help [color=special]Sierra[/color], you revealed your true nature, brutally exterminating [color=special]Lily[/color] from the game.
After taking the gold to [color=special]Sierra[/color], you took care of [color=special]Lily[/color] in a slightly less humane fashion, wiping her out of the game.
Having already killed [color=special]Sierra[/color] before giving her the gold delivery, you decided to do the same to [color=special]Lily[/color].
You delivered the gold to [color=special]Sierra[/color], helping her to sleep a little more easily at night.

quest.name: 5.2.npc1.quest
quest.title: The Siroccan Slayer
quest.description:
You met a very unbalanced man in the southwest corner of [color=special]Ouromova[/color]. He wants you to kill [color=special]every last person[/color] in the game. In return, he will reward you [color=special]very well[/color], allegedly.
He did point out that you should not kill him until he's had a chance to reward you.
quest.update: Before [color=special]Willy[/color] had a chance to tell you to start killing everyone, you killed him. That's kind of ironic.
You have begun the slaughter. You have killed $[npc.count.dead] out of $[npc.count.total] possible citizens of [color=special]Lelandria[/color].
A bit too eager, you put a quick end to [color=special]Willy[/color], ruining your chance of receiving his special rewards.
Now only [color=special]Willy[/color] remains alive in all of [color=special]Lelandria[/color]. Return to [color=special]Ouromova[/color] to collect your rewards.
You put a final touch on your work, eliminating [color=special]Willy[/color] and completely ridding the game of all talking characters.
You have decimated the entire civilian population of [color=special]Lelandria[/color]. Nice work.

quest.name: 5.4.npc1.quest
quest.title: One Merchant at a Time
quest.description:
Talking to [color=special]Logan[/color] on the northwest side of [color=special]Ouromova[/color], you learned that he wants to start working as a [color=special]merchant[/color]. Before he can do so, though, he needs you to convince his neighbor [color=special]Alice[/color] to close her business, as he doesn't want to steal her customers.
[color=special]Logan[/color] has asked you not to hurt [color=special]Alice[/color] if you can avoid it.
quest.update: Eschewing unnecessary violence, you gave [color=special]Alice[/color] enough gold to allow her to retire from the [color=special]merchant[/color] industry forever. You can now tell [color=special]Logan[/color] the good news.
Prior to learning about [color=special]Logan[/color]'s business needs, you put a cruel end to [color=special]Alice[/color].
You killed [color=special]Alice[/color] in cold blood, certainly putting an end to her days as a [color=special]merchant[/color]. You can now tell [color=special]Logan[/color] about what you've done.
After paying [color=special]Alice[/color] to close shop, you went back to close shop on [color=special]Alice[/color] in a more definitive fashion.
Having already killed [color=special]Logan[/color], dashing his dreams of entering into a new merchandising career, you decided to kill [color=special]Alice[/color] as well.
You didn't get a chance to speak with [color=special]Logan[/color], as you decided to obliterate him without a word.
Underwhelmed by [color=special]Logan[/color]'s ambitions, you went into business for yourself and exterminated him.
After giving [color=special]Logan[/color] a clean avenue to open his new business, you decided to do a little road construction.

Thanks to you, [color=special]Logan[/color] realized his life-long dream, beginning work as a [color=special]merchant[/color]. Even better, he ordered some [color=special]extra special items[/color] thanks to your fair handling of [color=special]Alice[/color].

Because of you, [color=special]Logan[/color] realized his life-long dream, beginning work as a [color=special]merchant[/color]. Because you killed [color=special]Alice[/color], though, he didn't have the energy to order the most special items available.

quest.name: 6.2.npc2.quest
quest.title: Map of the World
quest.description:
An avid cartography enthusiast named [color=special]Dani[/color] wants you to provide her with a complete map of the entire world of [color=special]Lelandria[/color].
To date, you have explored $[6.2.npc2.quest:percent-visited]% of [color=special]Lelandria[/color]. Visit every level in the game to complete your map!
quest.update: Before [color=special]Dani[/color] had mapped out what she wanted from you, you took her off of the map completely.
With no apparent remorse, you put a mean end to [color=special]Dani[/color] and her map lust.

Once you visited every last corner of [color=special]Lelandria[/color], you returned to [color=special]Dani[/color]. Instead of sharing your cartographical records with her, though, you decided to kill her.
After sharing the details of your expansive traveling with [color=special]Dani[/color], you decided you couldn't trust her with all of that information and put her down.

[color=special]Dani[/color] has not visited much of [color=special]Lelandria[/color], but she has seen most of the western portion. You paid her a little gold to share her geographical knowledge with you.
You have completed the entire map of [color=special]Lelandria[/color]. Return to the southeast side of [color=special]Callistaska[/color] to share it with [color=special]Dani[/color]!
You shared your complete map with [color=special]Dani[/color] and received a [color=special]special item[/color] in return.

quest.name: 6.5.npc1.quest
quest.title: Shutting down the Merchants
quest.description:
While exploring the southwest area of the happy town of [color=special]Callistaska[/color], you encountered a very unhappy man named [color=special]Han[/color]. He told you about how the merchants of [color=special]Lelandria[/color] banished him for failing to make some payments, and he requested that you kill [color=special]every merchant[/color] in the game, in the name of vengeance.
Currently $[merchant.count.living] merchants remain in [color=special]Lelandria[/color].
quest.update: [color=special]Han[/color] never had a chance to fully explain his hatred for all of the merchants in the game. You didn't let him.
You chose to kill [color=special]Han[/color].
After ridding [color=special]Lelandria[/color] of every last one of its active merchants, you sent [color=special]Han[/color] to join them.
Now that you have killed all active merchants in the game, you can return to [color=special]Han[/color] to collect his reward.
You gave [color=special]Han[/color] the good news and received some special items in return.

quest.name: 7.4.npc2.quest
quest.title: I Didn't Ask for This
quest.description: An unusual man named [color=special]JC[/color] asked you to give him a [color=special]skill point[/color]. He mentioned something about upgrading his augmentations to escape from the western edge of [color=special]Manderkeen[/color].
quest.update: Acting charitably, you donated a precious [color=special]skill point[/color] to [color=special]JC[/color]. He didn't exactly thank you profusely.
[color=special]JC[/color] is using one of his [color=special]neural augmentations[/color] to prevent you from killing him. You probably shouldn't even try.

Ultimately, [color=special]JC[/color] must have been just another delusional [color=special]cosplayer[/color]. You put an end to his games and recovered the [color=special]skill point[/color] you had given him.
Without taking any time to learn a single thing about [color=special]JC[/color], you sent him back to the cryotube he came from.
Instead of giving [color=special]JC[/color] the skill point he asked for, you gave him a piece of your mind. Does that mean he won't make a cameo in the sequel after all?

quest.name: 6.3.npc2.quest
quest.title: Jake, the Snake
quest.description: In the western town of [color=special]Callistaska[/color], you spent some time talking to a merchant named [color=special]Biggins[/color]. He told you about a troublemaker named [color=special]Jake[/color] who is blockading access to the best possible items in all of [color=special]Lelandria[/color]. If you kill [color=special]Jake[/color], [color=special]Biggins[/color] can sell you some [color=special]very special items[/color].
quest.update: You put out [color=special]Jake[/color]'s fire far in advance of hearing anything about the potential benefits of doing so.

You visited the far western edge of [color=special]Lelandria[/color], found [color=special]Jake[/color], and put him out of his misery. Return to [color=special]Biggins[/color] to browse his improved inventory!
After taking out the infamous [color=special]Biggins[/color], you turned around and made short order of [color=special]Jake[/color] as well.
[color=special]Biggins[/color] didn't live long enough to tell you anything about his quarrel with [color=special]Jake[/color]. You made sure of that.

Rather than help [color=special]Biggins[/color], you decided to side with [color=special]Jake[/color] and put the merchant himself out of business instead. [color=special]Jake[/color] will surely reward you handsomely!

You did just as [color=special]Biggins[/color] requested of you, but you then escalated things by destroying [color=special]Biggins[/color] himself, losing access to the best inventory of items in all of [color=special]Lelandria[/color].
You helped [color=special]Biggins[/color] establish his business as the best in all of [color=special]Lelandria[/color]. Then you killed him.
After some rigamarole, you ultimately received a nice gold reward from [color=special]Jake[/color].
[color=special]Biggins[/color] thanked you for your work and gave you access to an improved selection of items.
[color=special]Jake[/color] gave you a little bit of gold for not killing him without at least having a conversation about it first.
[color=special]Jake[/color] has suggested that you get rid of [color=special]Biggins[/color] instead. He hinted at some sort of financial reward.

quest.name: 7.1.npc1.quest
quest.title: A Lesser Operating System
quest.description: A struggling merchant named [color=special]William[/color] has asked you to destroy his competitor, [color=special]Linus[/color]. You will have to visit [color=special]Manderkeen[/color] to decide the fate of these merchants on your own.
quest.update: With a foresight worthy of the most precognitive sage, you put [color=special]William[/color] out of business without any explicit request to do so.
In a brilliant move, you put an end to [color=special]William[/color]'s business, enabling [color=special]Linus[/color] to continue offering his superior items for free.
After removing [color=special]Linus[/color] for no good reason, you tried to rectify your mistake by putting [color=special]William[/color] in the recycle bin.
After taking the misstep of killing [color=special]Linus[/color], you took a step to make amends, resigning [color=special]William[/color] to the same fate.
You gave [color=special]William[/color] the good news after completing his job. Then you completed a job of your own, deleting [color=special]William[/color] from the level.
For no discernible reason, you removed [color=special]Linus[/color] from the game with no obvious quest reward on the line.

In a moment short of brilliance, you shut down [color=special]Linus[/color]'s free items store, enabling [color=special]William[/color] to continue his monopoly. You should report back to [color=special]William[/color] to let him know about what you've done.
Having already gotten rid of [color=special]William[/color], you for some reason decided to get rid of [color=special]Linus[/color] as well.
[color=special]William[/color] has modified his inventory to include some [color=special]cheap[/color] items. You can determine what "cheap" means for yourself, in this case.
